meanings.definition: The quality or state of being mazy.
meanings.sent1: The mazinesses of the maze made it challenging to find the exit.
meanings.sent2: The forest's mazinesses made it easy to get lost.
meanings.sent3: Trying to navigate through the mazinesses of the city without a map was quite an adventure.
meanings.sent4: The mazinesses of her thoughts mirrored the intricate paths of a labyrinth.
meanings.sent5: The mazinesses of the puzzle were so complex that it took hours to solve.

meanings.definition: The condition of being full of twists and turns.
meanings.sent1: The river's mazinesses made it exciting to kayak through.
meanings.sent2: The plot of the movie had unexpected mazinesses that kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent3: The mazinesses of the rollercoaster track added thrill to the ride.
meanings.sent4: Her journey through the mazinesses of life led her to unexpected opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The mazinesses of the mystery novel kept readers guessing until the end.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being confusing or labyrinthine.
meanings.sent1: The mazinesses of the old building's layout confused visitors.
meanings.sent2: The mazinesses of the legal system can be overwhelming for newcomers.
meanings.sent3: Trying to understand the mazinesses of the new software was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The mazinesses of the conspiracy theory led to unexpected revelations.
meanings.sent5: The mazinesses of the plot in the book kept readers intrigued.
